text: General elections were held in Montserrat on 18 March 1955.General Election Results - 18 March 1955 Caribbean Elections The result was a victory for the Montserrat Labour Party, which won three of the five seats in the Legislative Council. The other two seats were taken by the independent candidate Robert William Griffith (who had left the MLP) and a Merchant Planter, William Lleweyn Wall.Howard A Fergus (1985) Rule Britannia: Politics in British Montserrat, University Centre, p19 ==Results== {| class=wikitable style=text- align:right !Party !Votes !% !Seats !+/– |- |align=left|Montserrat Labour Party||1,246||47.4||3||–2 |- |align=left|Independents||1,385||52.6||2||+2 |- |align=left|Invalid/blank votes|| ||–||–||24 |- |align=left|Total||2,824|| ||5||0 |- |align=left|Registered voters/turnout||2,911|| ||–||– |- |align=left colspan=5|Source: EmmanuelPatrick A Emmanuel (1992) Elections & Party Systems in the Commonwealth Caribbean 1944-1991, Caribbean Development Research Service, pp10–24 |} ==References== 1955 Category:1955 elections in the Caribbean Category:1955 in Montserrat 1955 Category:March 1955 events
title: 1955 Montserratian general election
